DOC.brief_summary: The author measure passive tidal volume generate external chest compression order determine whether chest compression alone without mechanical ventilatory support cardiopulmonary resuscitation provide adequate ventilation . The author study 25 volunteer meet follow inclusion criterion : age 18-55 year , ASA I-II , candidate surgical operation , receive general anesthesia . Patients operate chest , present musculoskeletal disease , cardiopulmonary vascular acute chronic disease , history pneumothorax , thromboembolism , osteoporosis , menopause , history current rib sternal clavicle fracture , exclude . All eligible patient enter study receive general anesthesia intubation accord treat doctor ' decision . Patients ventilate mechanically 5 minute establish stable condition . A pneumotachograph connect ventilatory circuit respiratory effort ( volume , airway pressure flow ) continuously monitor real time . An esophageal catheter insert monitor esophageal pressure provide data lung mechanic calculation . Following procedure surgical procedure , chest compression perform patient senior anesthesiologist accord ERC guideline 2010 30 second . Following chest compression , patient evaluate possible complication establishment stable condition surgical procedure follow . After end surgical operation clinical chest ultrasound evaluation perform . Written inform consent obtain patient procedure .
DOC.criteria: age 1855 year ASA III candidate surgical operation receive general anesthesia surgical operation chest musculoskeletal disease cardiopulmonary vascular acute chronic disease history pneumothorax thromboembolism osteoporosis menopause history current rib sternal clavicle fracture
